text: Robby Müller (4 April 1940 - 4 July 2018) was a Dutch cinematographer. He worked with director Wim Wenders. He was known for his works in To Live and Die in LA, Sally Potter's The Tango Lesson, My Brother Tom, Breaking the Waves and Dancer in the Dark. Müller was born in Willemstad, Curaçao. He died on 4 July 2018 from vascular dementia in Amsterdam at the age of 78.Robby Müller death: Cinematographer nicknamed 'master of light' dies aged 78 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1940 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Cinematographers Category:Curaçao people Category:Deaths from vascular dementia
title: Robby Müller
